Module edu.uoc.nertia
Package edu.uoc.nertia.controller

Class Game

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.nertia.controller.Game
public class Game extends Object
Controller class of the game. It is the middleware (or bridge) between the model and view classes.
This class is called from the view classes in order to access/modify the model data.
Author:
David García-Solórzano

    • Game

      public Game(String fileFolder) throws IOException
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      fileFolder - Folder name where the configuration/level files are.
      Throws:
      IOException - When there is a problem while retrieving number of levels

      public int getBoardSize()
      Returns the size of the board. The board is NxN.
      Returns:
      Value of the board's size.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int column) throws LevelException
      Returns the Cell object which is in the position (row,column).
      Parameters:
      row - Row in which the cell we want to retrieve is
      column - Column in which the cell we want to retrieve is
      Returns:
      The cell that is in the position (row,column).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either the row or the column is wrong.

    • getDifficulty

      public LevelDifficulty getDifficulty()
      Returns the difficulty of the current level.
      Returns:
      The difficulty of the current level.

    • getNumMoves

      public int getNumMoves()
      Returns the number of moves that have been done in the current level so far.
      Returns:
      Number of moves that the player has done so far. If level is null, then returns 0.

    • getNumLives

      public int getNumLives()
      Returns the number of lives that the player has.
      Returns:
      Number of lives.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Indicates if the game is finished (true) or not (false).

      The game is finished when the attribute currentLevel is equal to attribute maxLevels.

      Returns:
      True if there are no more levels and therefore the game is finished. Otherwise, false.

    • getCurrentLevel

      public int getCurrentLevel()
      Getter of the attribute currentLevel.
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute currentLevel that indicates which level the player is playing.

    • nextLevel

      public boolean nextLevel() throws LevelException
      Checks if there is a new level to play and loads it.
      If the game is finished, it returns false. Otherwise, it returns true. The game score must be updated when a level is finished. Thus, when the player is playing the first level, game's score is zero.
      Returns:
      True if there is a next level, and it has been loaded correctly. Otherwise, it returns false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem loading the new level.

    • loadLevel

      private void loadLevel() throws LevelException
      Loads a new level by using the value of the attribute currentLevel.

      The pattern of the filename is: fileFolder+"level" + numberLevel + ".txt".

      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • isLevelCompleted

      public boolean isLevelCompleted()
      Checks if the level is completed, i.e. the player has collected all the gems of the board.
      Returns:
      true if this level is beaten, otherwise false.

    • hasLost

      public boolean hasLost()
      Checks if the player has lost, i.e. the number of lives is zero.
      Returns:
      true if this the player has lost, otherwise false.

    • undo

      public boolean undo() throws LevelException
      Undo one move from the level's stack.
      Returns:
      true if one move has been undone, otherwise false (e.g. the stack is empty).
      Throws:
      LevelException - When either the row or the column is wrong.

    • reload

      public void reload() throws LevelException
      Reloads the current level, i.e. load the level again.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is a level exception/problem.

    • movePlayer

      public MoveResult movePlayer(Direction direction) throws LevelException
      Moves the player in the given direction. If the move ends in:
      • a mine, then it returns MoveResult.DIE
      • another kind of cell, then it returns MoveResult.OK
      If the first cell is out of bounds, then it returns MoveResult.KO (i.e. INVALID move)
      Parameters:
      direction - Direction to move the player in.
      Returns:
      MoveResult object the move is done.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If there are any problems with increaseNumGemsGot.

    • isInLeaderBoard

      public boolean isInLeaderBoard()
      Checks if the score gotten by the player deserves to be stored in the leaderboard.
      Returns:
      true if the score can be stored in the leaderboard. Otherwise, false.

    • addToLeaderBoard

      public void addToLeaderBoard(String name)
      Add the score in the leaderboard.
      Parameters:
      name - Player's name.

    • displayLeaderBoard

      public void displayLeaderBoard()
      Prints the leaderboard.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the status of the game at that moment.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Textual version of the game. This includes the board and level's status.
